noun.description: A kind of smooth, durable linen fabric, used chiefly for window shades and furniture covering.

proper noun.description: A city in southwestern Michigan, noted for its Dutch heritage; population 34,076 (est. 2008).

origin: Middle English: from Holland, the name of a former province of the Netherlands where the cloth was made, from Dutch, earlier Holtlant (from holt wood + -lant land).
